title: Akron Beacon Journal - Wikipedia
snippet: The McClatchy Company bought Knight Ridder in June 2006 with intentions of selling 12 Knight Ridder newspapers. On August 2, 2006, McClatchy sold the Beacon Journal to Black Press. In 2018, GateHouse Media bought the newspaper. On November 11, 2013, the Akron Beacon Journal printed its last ...

title: Akron Beacon Journal Sold to GateHouse Media, Owner of Columbus Dispatch, Canton Repository
snippet: The Akron Beacon Journal has been sold to Gatehouse Media, the largest publisher of daily newspapers in the United States and the owner of the Columbus Dispatch, the Canton Repository and a preponderance of smaller-town dailies.

title: Akron Beacon Journal 2025 Company Profile: Valuation, Investors, Acquisition | PitchBook

title: Updated plan for former Beacon Journal building includes 120 affordable apartments
snippet: The 44 E. Exchange St. building has been vacant since the Beacon Journal moved its offices to the AES Building in downtown Akron in 2019. Summit County Fiscal Office records show ABJ Building LLC purchased the property for $1.1 million from Beacon Journal Publishing Co. in August 2020. In December 2023, the Ohio Department of Development announced a more than $5 million tax credit for a previous proposal by Troppe to convert the building to a mixed-use concept with 197 apartment units at a total project cost of more than $54 million.
